intro: Antigramma brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian antigramma, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and lobed leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. Antigramma brasiliensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
